parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden failure of the main drive belt can cause the rear wheel to lock up, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially catastrophic consequences, including injuries and fatalities.
symptoms: the motorcycle slides or loses control

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden loss of power due to electrical system failure can cause the vehicle to shut down while in motion, increasing the risk of accidents, injuries, and fatalities.
symptoms: the main circuit breaker cuts out
the vehicle drifts to the side of the road.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Tire Failure (Dunlop D-402 Wide Whitewall)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden failure of the rear tire can cause the motorcycle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, and even fatalities.
symptoms: causing the motorcycle to fishtail violently
and potentially leading to loss of control and accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The separation of the tire can cause the motorcycle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, and even fatalities.
symptoms: The tire appears to have separated
leading to a sudden loss of air pressure
causing the motorcycle to lose control and potentially leading to accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Brake Failure due to Master Cylinder Design and DOT 5 Brake Fluid
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The poor design of the master cylinder, mounted too close to the exhaust, in combination with the use of DOT 5 brake fluid, can cause air to enter the brake system, leading to rear brake failure, which can result in reduced stopping power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: brake pedal travels further than usual

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent stalling of the engine can cause the motorcycle to lose power and stall, potentially leading to accidents or injuries, especially if the stalling occurs at high speeds or in heavy traffic.
symptoms: The engine stalls intermittently while driving at various speeds
the motorcycle is unable to restart immediately
the motorcycle can only be restarted after a delay of 30-60 seconds.
